entry.title: Meeting Summary & Logs for CTV Meeting #5
entry.summary: In a bitcoin-dev mailing list, Jeremy Rubin shared updates on various topics. Firstly, Sapio has Experimental Taproot Support now, and he mentioned that Rust-bitcoin can use help reviewing. Secondly, he explained the concept of Transaction Sponsors and why it doesn't have a BIP # assigned. Thirdly, James' Vaults Post was discussed, which is similar to prior art on recursive CTV vaults. Fourthly, the mailing list had a conversation about adding more power to protocols, and some proposed solutions for infrastructure issues for more flexible covenants. Finally, there was a general discussion on naming conventions and forking, with some participants expressing concern about ST and proposing unique names like "Hot Tub Coin Machine" and "OP_DOTHETHING".
